titleStmt.title: His Majesties most gratious ansvver at the delivery of the propositions for peace. Certified to the Parliament by a letter from the Earle of Pembrook, and the commissioners. Who presented them to the King on Tuesday last, at Hampton Court, Septemb. 7. 1647. Also His Majesties last propositions.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

titleStmt.title: His Majesties most gratious ansvver at the delivery of the propositions for peace. Certified to the Parliament by a letter from the Earle of Pembrook, and the commissioners. Who presented them to the King on Tuesday last, at Hampton Court, Septemb. 7. 1647. Also His Majesties last propositions.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Pembroke, Philip Herbert, Earl of, 1584-1650.
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: The propositions referred to in the title are Charles I's of May 12, 1647; his answer is narrated on page 6, in "A letter from a gentleman at Hampton Court", which is dated at end: the 8. of Septemb. 1647.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
